page.title: 17St.Andrew's School Chadd'wth
page.content: This is one of Berkshire's oldest schools.Foundation of the school was made in 1719 from the will of William Saunders.The buildings date from 1823. The school house was added in 1840.It was modernised in 1961 when extensive additions were made to the school.It is in the centre of Chaddleworth on a site of 1.9 acres with a hard play- ground and grass field.There are two classrooms a hall/diningroom, library area,office,tiolets for staff and boys & girls.The kitchen reheats frozen meals sent from a large school in Newbury. The teaching staff consists of Head teacher plus one fulltime assistant and another halftime. There is a secretary for 3 mornings a week a lunch supervisor,controller and a cleaner in charge.In the last decade the highest number on roll has been 49 at present there are 20 pupils.
